results.title: 2007 Lantern Parade
results.creator_credit: Paul Bray, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Paul Bray talks about the beauty of the Lantern Parade, an event he has participated in since 2005. He considers the affect parades have on the community and the collective sense of joy and wellbeing.

results.title: 2006 Contemporary Commonwealth [exhibition] : artist images and documentation
results.brief_description:
“2006 Contemporary Commonwealth” was an ACMI Screen Gallery Exhibition, held 24 February 2006 - 14 May 2006.

Joint Exhibition with NGVA as part of Cultural Festival for the 2006 Commonwealth Games. ACMI will show 6 international and 6 Australian Artists.

See Exhibition activity record “2006 contemporary commonwealth” (ID 21) for more information

results.title: 2001: A Space odyssey [DVD]
results.brief_description: Light years ahead of it’s time, Kubrick’s masterpiece has an awesome scope - his special effects border on miraculous. Inspired by Arthur C. Clarke’s epic book, 2001 moves from the prehistoric birth of intelligence to the emergence of the man as pure thought, somewhere in the future. Cast includes Keir Dullea and Gary Lockwood.

results.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1968
results.brief_description: Humanity finds a mysterious object buried beneath the lunar surface and sets off to find its origins with the help of HAL 9000, the world’s most advanced super computer, in Stanley Kubrick’s masterpiece, which pushed cinematic narratives and special effects.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

constellations_other.name: Future visions
constellations_other.description: Entities is a time-based data visualisation of visitors collecting objects and exploring Constellations. These actions are translated into graphical forms to show what’s being collected, as well as highlighting Constellations that share connections.

constellations_other.name: Kaleidoscopic colour: Chromotrope
constellations_other.description: A focus on distinctive and innovative examples of pattern, colour and movement.

constellations_other.name: Auteurs, influence and inspiration
constellations_other.description: A tradition of influence and inspiration beginning with Eisenstein.

constellations_other.name: The Kubrick connection
constellations_other.description: The visual effects for Blade Runner drew on a number of techniques from other iconic films, including two of Stanley Kubrick's masterpieces.

constellations_other.name: Evil AI, dystopias and production design
constellations_other.description: In No Code’s sci-fi thriller players take command of a multi-national space station’s artificial intelligence system to help the sole survivor solve the mystery of a missing crew and why the station is wildly off course.

constellations_other.name: Space, cinema and fakes
constellations_other.description: Before and after humans stepped foot on the moon, outer-space and the stars have inspired filmmakers, artists and game makers to imagine what's beyond our atmosphere.

results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1968

results.title: 2000 Australian TV miniature
results.credit_line: Designed by Graham McGuffie, Emily Boutard and Megafun
results.brief_description: This gorgeous miniature model celebrates memorable moments from the 2000s.

constellations_primary.name: 2000s TV
constellations_primary.description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

results.description: It’s noice, it’s different, it’s unusual. Gina Riley and Jane Turner’s hugely popular Kath & Kim hit screens in 2002, poking fun at Aussie suburbia and spawning a trend of mockumentary-style sitcoms. Meanwhile another female-driven show The Secret Life Of Us was breaking boundaries on Channel 10: Deborah Mailman’s casting was a landmark moment for representation of Indigenous Australians in mainstream media. The hit series also acted as a training ground for a whole wave of prominent female filmmakers like Cate Shortland, Ana Kokkinos and Emma Freeman. Public broadcasters SBS and ABC had very different successes with East West 101 for the former – a multicultural police procedural – and animated series Bluey becoming a global phenomenon for the latter.
description_for_label: It’s noice, it’s different, it’s unusual. Meanwhile another female-driven show The Secret Life Of Us was breaking boundaries on Channel 10: Deborah Mailman’s casting was a landmark moment for representation of Indigenous Australians in mainstream media. The hit series also acted as a training ground for a whole wave of prominent female filmmakers like Cate Shortland, Ana Kokkinos and Emma Freeman. Public broadcasters SBS and ABC had very different successes with East West 101 for the former – a multicultural police procedural – and animated series Bluey becoming a global phenomenon for the latter.

results.title: 2000 Today
results.creator_credit: Stewart Burchmore and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Share the excitement as we venture to all parts of Australia to welcome in the new millenium. Featuring highlights from spectacular fireworks across Australia, including Sydney Harbour, images from the Dawn Performance on the sails of the Sydney Opera House, the Woodford Fire Festival, and the traditional Aboriginal “Inma” ceremony and “Mimi” spirit stilt dance. The greatest celebration Australia has ever seen.

results.title: 200,000 reasons
results.creator_credit: Eric Fullilove, Andrew J. Helgeson, British Petroleum and Austral Pacific Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the life and work of some 27,000 members of the Surf Life Saving Association of Australia. Stresses the similarity between the surfer and the life-saver, and looks at the range of equipment used in rescue - jet boats, radios and 4-wheel drive vehicles. Includes scenes of training, competition and club life.

results.title: 200 cigarettes
results.creator_credit: Risa Bramon Garcia, Van Toffler, David Gale, Betsy Beers, Dogstar Films, MTV Films, Lakeshore Entertainment and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in Lower Manhattan, New Year’s Eve, 1981, “200 Cigarettes” is an ensemble comedy/drama about a disparate group of twenty-somethings looking for love, sex and somewhere to party. Monica has planned a party but as the night wears on and no-one arrives she drinks, stresses and stews over her life. Her cousin Val and friend Stephie, wander around the city in search of the party, hooking up with two neo-punks Tom and Dave. Kevin bemoans his fate having been dumped the night before by performance artist Ellie, and is comforted by a friend Lucy, to whom he is forming an attraction. The film follows the dozen or so intended guests as they make their way to the party via taxis, nightclubs and cafes. The film has an episodic structure, seeking to lay patterns of interconnectedness amidst a slew of characters. However no real depth of scale and social meaning is ever achieved. Instead the characters remain frivolous and shallow - but with a hip eighties soundtrack and a top cast, the film is an amusing diversion. Features: Ben Affleck, Casey Affleck, Janeane Garofalo, Paul Rudd, Courtney Love, Martha Plimpton, David Chappelle, Kate Hudson, Jay Mohr, Christina Ricci.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Risa Bramon Garcia, Van Toffler, David Gale, Betsy Beers, Dogstar Films, MTV Films, Lakeshore Entertainment and Paramount Pictures

results.title: 20,000 leagues under the sea [study extract]
results.brief_description: From the book by Jules Verne. A breathtaking adventure aboard the “Nautilus”, the nuclear-powered submarine controlled by evil genius Captain Nemo. The cast includes James Mason, Kirk Douglas and Peter Lorne. The film prompts discussion about nuclear energy.
